segments.text: Watching the woman dry the plate, I feel a sense of nostalgia.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It reminds me of my own mother, so dedicated to making everything perfect at home.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I spot the water cascading over the sink's edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: My heart races as I think of the potential mess that will follow.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Is she really oblivious to the flood at her feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but notice the kids plotting their cookie heist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s precarious position makes me angry; he could fall any minute!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the way the girl stands there, hand raised, waiting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost comical, yet I feel disgusted by their sneaky antics.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they don’t break something or worse, fall and hurt themselves.
segments.speaker: PAR
